items.from_string: Develop helm chart for crossplane manager deployment to deploy the Go-based app
items.to_string:
Title: Develop helm chart for crossplane manager deployment to deploy the Go-based app

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI infrastructure engineer, I want to develop a separate helm chart for the crossplane API so that it can be deployed independently from the bip-ai-gateway.

Acceptance Criteria: Given the crossplane API requirements when I create the helm chart then it includes all necessary deployment configurations Given the new helm chart when I deploy it to SBX then the crossplane API runs independently from bip-ai-gateway Given the deployed crossplane manager when I test its functionality then it behaves identically to the current Python deployment Given the separated deployment when I validate API endpoints then all crossplane operations function correctly Given the helm chart when I configure it then it uses the hardened Go base image Given the independent deployment when I monitor it then it maintains the same performance characteristics as the Python version Definition of Done: All acceptance criteria met Helm chart tested and validated in SBX environment Documentation updated with deployment instructions Chart follows BIP helm chart standards and conventions Monitoring and logging configured for independent deployment Dependencies: Hardened Go image for crossplane API.

Title: Create Lambda Usage Tutorial Notebook

Value Statement: As as a BIP MLOps engineer, I want a tutorial Jupyter notebook that demonstrates how to create, configure, and invoke AWS Lambda functions, so that I can quickly understand and test Lambda integrations for data processing, SageMaker jobs, and other automation workflows. Description: Develop a step-by-step tutorial notebook showcasing how to use AWS Lambda within our environment. The notebook should walk users through Lambda creation, permissions setup, event triggers, and function invocation from Python. It should include clear explanations and example code blocks to help users learn and replicate the process. This tutorial will serve as an internal reference for teams integrating Lambda functions with SageMaker, Bedrock, and related services.

Acceptance Criteria: Notebook Structure - Notebook is created in Jupyter format (.ipynb) and stored in the tenant. Sections include: - Introduction / Overview of Lambda - Creating a Lambda function (step-by-step) - Setting IAM roles and permissions - Invoking the function programmatically (via boto3) - Example: triggering a SageMaker Processing job or workflow Code Examples Includes fully functional Python code cells for: - Creating and deploying a Lambda function - Testing invocation and handling responses - Example Lambda function demonstrates reading from and writing to S3. Documentation - Inline markdown explanations clarify each step. - Includes guidance on debugging, logs (CloudWatch), and cost monitoring. - References official AWS docs and internal best practices if available.

Title: Promote Updated Grafana Dashboards to Upper Environments

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer who manages dashboard deployments, I need the ability to promote updated Grafana dashboards (including Bedrock metrics and model name updates) to upper environments so that users in all environments have consistent visibility into Bedrock model performance.

Acceptance Criteria: - When the updated dashboards are validated in development, they are promoted to upper Grafana environments using the approved deployment or import process. - Data source configurations and permissions are verified to ensure panels render correctly in upper environments. - Documentation describing dashboard promotion steps and environment-specific differences is updated. - A manual validation checklist or automated test confirms that dashboards render correctly post-promotion.

Title: Create Example for Strands Graph workflow including mlkit functional code

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer, I want to create an example for Strands Graph multi-agent collaboration, so tenants can more easily create strands agents with multiple agents.

Acceptance Criteria: - Example notebook created with multiple agents collaborating through a graph workflow - agents using MLKit's strands wrapper for logging - Functional code added to MLKit.

Title: Create alerts for Lambda metrics for MLOps team

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer who manages Grafana alerting, I need the ability to create a Grafana alert when tenant lambda metrics are collected so that we are able to monitor and ensure that the lambdas are preforming as expected.

Acceptance Criteria: - Identify the tenants that are using lambdas - Create alerts for when tenant lambdas fail. - Create alerts on reaching lambda quotas - Identify other potential metrics/alerts - Update MLOps dashboard documentation in confluence
This issue is cloned by BIP-28943

Title: Fix Code Editor LCC Attachment

Value Statement: As an MLE creating and maintaining MLKit, I want to attach the dev and stable LCCs to all CodeEditor domains and remove unused LCCs so that tenants only have one LCC to choose from

AC: LCCs tested and pushed to all domains, all other LCCs removed from tenant domains.

Title: Incorporate Agentic Code in Bedrock Tutorials into RAF

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer, I want to review the new CTO Strands base agent template and determine which components can be adopted or integrated into the Reusable Agentic Framework (RAF), so that the RAF benefits from the latest best practices and reusable patterns demonstrated in the Bedrock tutorials.

Acceptance Criteria: - The CTO Strands base agent template is reviewed for relevance, structure, and reusability. - Useful components or design patterns identified from the template are documented. - Applicable portions of the template are incorporated or adapted into the RAF within the bip-ai-kit repository. - Corresponding tutorial code in the bip-ai-tenant-resources repository is updated to align with the new RAF structure and reference the reusable components.

items.from_string: Review and extract code from strands base agent project
items.to_string: Review and extract code from CTO strands base agent project

Title: Create and Route Grafana Alerts to Slack in Upper Environments

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer who manages monitoring and alerting configurations, I need the ability to create and route Grafana alerts in upper environments based on existing lower-environment configurations so that model performance issues and infrastructure anomalies are consistently surfaced to the appropriate Slack channels across all environments.

Acceptance Criteria:

-When updated dashboards and metrics are available in upper environments, corresponding Grafana alerts are created using the same configuration logic and thresholds as lower environments.

-Alerts are validated to route correctly to existing non-prod and prod Slack channels with appropriate annotations (e.g., environment, model name, and alert type). -Documentation detailing alert creation, Slack routing configuration, and validation steps is updated.

-Manual validation or automated test confirms alerts trigger and deliver expected messages to Slack.

Title: Enable CloudWatch Logging for Bedrock Batch Inference Jobs

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer or tenant who runs Bedrock batch inference jobs, I need the ability to log job completions, failures, and execution times to Amazon CloudWatch so that I can monitor performance, detect issues quickly, and maintain operational visibility into batch inference workflows.

Acceptance Criteria:
 * When a Bedrock batch inference job completes or fails, the job status, duration, and relevant metadata are automatically logged to CloudWatch Logs.
 * - When logs are written, they are structured and searchable by job ID and timestamp to support monitoring and troubleshooting.
 * - Automated tests or validation scripts confirm that successful and failed batch runs generate corresponding log entries in CloudWatch.

Title: Incorporate reusable agent code from Bedrock tutorials to MLKit and improve the Bedrock Manager class

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer, I want to incorporate code from the existing tenant-resources notebook on Agents to MLKit, so tenants can more accelerate Bedrock agents development with appropriate tooling

Acceptance Criteria:

- Bedrock Agent tool calling functionality moved to MLKit BedrockManager.py that was found in the notebooks
 * tenants can use functional tools within Bedrock Manager for developing agents, like listing agents related to tenant, etc.
 * - add any code to improve the mlkit agent functionality from EVA.
 * - update tutorial notebook to use mlkit
This issue is cloned by BIP-28769
This issue is cloned by BIP-28975
This issue is cloned by BIP-29002

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer, I want to create an example for Strands Graph multi-agent communication using structured outputs, so tenants can use structured agents in graph workflows

Acceptance Criteria:
 * Example notebook created with multiple agents communicating with Pydantic outputs through a graph workflow
 * - Functional code added to MLKit

items.from_string:
pipeline for deploying sage maker endpoint - As a BIP AI  engineer, I want to create a golden set, highly templatized Harness pipeline for deploying SageMaker endpoints, so that teams can quickly reuse and adapt the pipeline for different endpoints using input sets.

AC: 
Harness pipeline is created to automate deployment of SageMaker endpoints.
The pipeline supports a variety of input sets (e.g., model name, instance type, endpoint config, environment).
The pipeline is modular and templatized, allowing easy customization and reuse.
The pipeline is saved as a Harness template and documented for other users to pull and use.
The template supports parameterization for common deployment variables.
Pipeline is tested and validated for at least one real deployment scenario.

Title: Create Harness Pipeline for SageMaker Endpoints

**Value Statement**
As a DevOps Engineer, I want to create a Harness pipeline for SageMaker endpoints, so that we can deploy and manage SageMaker endpoints directly from Harness while replicating the functionality of the existing Jenkins SageMaker endpoints pipeline.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- A new Harness pipeline is designed to deploy SageMaker endpoints.
- Logging, error handling, and job monitoring are implemented as in Jenkins.
- Permissions and secrets are managed securely in Harness.
- Documentation is provided for how to use and modify the pipeline.
- The pipeline is validated by running at least one end-to-end endpoint deployment.

items.to_string:
Title: Create Harness Pipeline for SageMaker Endpoints

**Value Statement** As a DevOps Engineer, I want to create a Harness pipeline for SageMaker endpoints, so that we can deploy and manage SageMaker endpoints directly from Harness while replicating the functionality of the existing Jenkins SageMaker endpoints pipeline.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
 * A new Harness pipeline is designed to deploy SageMaker endpoints.
 * - Logging, error handling, and job monitoring are implemented as in Jenkins.
 * - Permissions and secrets are managed securely in Harness. 
 * Documentation is provided for how to use and modify the pipeline. -
 * The pipeline is validated by running at least one end-to-end endpoint deployment.

Value Statement: As a DevOps Engineer, I want to plan and design an Infrastructure as Code (IaC) smoketest pipeline within Harness, and organize an engineering review meeting for it, so that we can validate IaC changes early and ensure high-quality deployments.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
 * Requirements for the IaC smoketest pipeline are gathered and documented.
 * - The pipeline design is drafted with clear stages, tools, and quality gates.
 * - Engineering review meeting is scheduled with relevant stakeholders.
 * - Design and requirements are presented and reviewed in the meeting.
 * - Feedback from the review is documented for next steps.

Title: Create Harness Load Testing pipeline **User Story** As a DevOps Engineer, I want to create and implement a load testing pipeline that uses the load testing image stored in Nexus, so that we can automate performance validation for our services. Before creating the pipeline, the Nexus image must be updated to use the IronBank base Python image to meet security and compliance requirements.

**Acceptance Criteria:** - The existing load testing image in Nexus is identified and updated to use the IronBank base Python image.
 * All dependencies and scripts are validated to work with the new base image.
 * - The updated image is built, tested, and pushed back to Nexus.
 * - A new load testing pipeline is designed and implemented in Harness utilizing the updated image. - The pipeline supports parameterization for different environments and scenarios.

items.from_string: Test OITBIPAIBuilder Service Account Integration with Playwright Scripts
items.to_string:
Title: Test OITBIPAIBuilder Service Account Integration with Playwright Scripts

Value Statement: As a DevOps Engineer, I want to test the OITBIPAIBuilder service account integration with Playwright scripts, so that I can ensure the service account can successfully log in to the BIP AI Gateway using automated tests.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
 * Playwright scripts are updated or created to use the OITBIPAIBuilder service account credentials for login.
 * - Automated tests validate that the login process works end-to-end on the BIP AI Gateway.
 * - Any login failures or errors are clearly reported with details for troubleshooting.

Title: Create Harness Trigger for MLKIT Builds (Dev Only) and Update MLKIT to Use Harness for Dev Builds

**Value Statement** As a DevOps Engineer, I want to create a Harness trigger for MLKIT builds in the development environment, so that whenever there is a new release or other relevant event in the MLKIT dev branch or for dev releases, a build is automatically triggered. Additionally, I want to update MLKIT to use Harness for its dev build process, replacing any legacy build automation for development.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
 * The MLKIT dev build process is migrated from the legacy build solution (e.g., Jenkins or similar) to Harness for development.
 * - A Harness trigger is configured to listen for new releases (and/or other relevant events) in the MLKIT repository, scoped to the dev branch or dev releases only.
 * - When a new dev release is published or event occurs, the Harness pipeline for MLKIT (dev) is automatically triggered.
 * - The pipeline executes the MLKIT dev build process successfully in Harness.
 * - Documentation is updated to explain the new process, trigger setup, and any changes needed for developers working in dev.
 * - The process is validated by at least one successful dev build triggered by a dev release event.
This issue is cloned by BIP-28745

Additionally, I want to update MLKIT to use Harness for its dev build process, replacing any legacy build automation for development.

 * - When a new dev release is published or event occurs, the Harness pipeline for MLKIT (dev) is automatically triggered.

Title
Apply hardened python base image to bip-ai-kit to improve security

Value Statement
As a BIP AI team member who manages base image used in application build, I need the ability to  upgrade the lambda base image to pull from the new hardened Python base image instead of ironbank for consistency and to improve security

Acceptance Criteria
1 . Upgrade base image to one of the following:
- 261727212250.dkr.ecr.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/mlmats/python:3.12.12
- 261727212250.dkr.ecr.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/mlmats/python:3.13.1
2. Build is successful

Title: Integrate CodeQL Scans into Image builder pipeline

Value Statement: As a DevOps Engineer, I want to integrate CodeQL scans into the Image Builder pipeline on Harness, so that application images are automatically scanned for potential security vulnerabilities as part of the CI/CD process.

AC:

- The existing CodeQL scan template in Harness is utilized with no manual duplication or recreation.
 * CodeQL scan steps are added to the Image Builder pipeline YAML/workflow.
 * - Scans run automatically as part of the Image Builder pipeline execution in Harness.
 * - Scan results are visible in the Harness UI and accessible to the team.

Title: Create a service role to use for Agent execution

As a ML Engineer I want a service role that agents can use that will include access to foundation models, KB, lambdas and any other function needed.

AC: Service role made in Crossplane to connect to agents since tenant roles had access to foundational models removed

Title: Limit ARIA requests per minute

As a ML Engineer I want to limit the amount of requests to ARIA per minute to make sure it stays within BIP AI account.

AC: Block created to stop too many requests coming into ARIA per minute to help with account wide limit

items.from_string:
**Value Statement:** As a platform engineer, I want the core API foundation migrated from Python to Go so that I can test basic functionality locally and validate the performance improvements.

**Assumptions:** - Current Go project structure in bip-crossplane-manager will be the foundation - Local testing environment can be established with existing Kubernetes access - Core routes include /, /config, /health, and basic authentication middleware.

**Acceptance Criteria:** - Given the Go API server when I start it locally then it responds to health checks - Given a request to the root endpoint when authenticated then it returns API metadata including version and environment - Given a request to /config when authenticated then it returns the same configuration format as the Python API - Given any authenticated request when processed then user authentication works via existing OAuth2 proxy headers - Given the core middleware when implemented then CORS, logging, and authentication are properly handled - Given the basic route structure when established then it follows the documented pattern in STRUCTURE.md - Given the Kubernetes client integration when tested then it can successfully connect to the cluster.

**Definition of Done:** - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit + integration) - Documentation updated in README - Local development environment setup documented - Authentication middleware tested with sample requests - Basic route structure established per STRUCTURE.md / ROUTES.md - Go modules and dependencies properly configured.
items.to_string:
As a BIP-AI Infra engineer, I need to recover resources and application deployments that are failing after the DEV cluster outage.A/C: * All BIP-AI and tenant Crossplane resources healthy/synced
 * BIP-AI Gateway pods deploy successfully with access to REDIS cache
 * AI Gateway front-end accessible and functioning normal
 * Tenant MLFlow instances reachable/functioning

items.from_string:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI developer who supports tenant workflows with Bedrock agents, I need the ability to create EVA's agents with IAC so that agent management can be automated for consist and easy recreation.

AC: Recreate all EVA agents, starting with dev agent, using IAC. Once dev agent is successfully created and tested, recreate stage agent, and create new PreProd agent.
items.to_string:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI developer who supports tenant workflows with Lambdas, I need the ability to create EVA's lambdas with IAC so that agent management can be automated for consistent and easy recreation.

AC: Recreate all EVA lambdas with IAC, starting in dev and moving up to preprod. Retain all configurations from existing lambdas and test to minimize problems when transitioning to using new lambdas.

items.from_string:
Value Statement:

As a BIP AI engineer, I need the ECR connector configured to use static Harness secrets instead of Vault so that the image promotion pipeline executes reliably without intermittent authentication failures caused by Vault connectivity issues.

Acceptance Criteria:
•     ECR credential secrets created in Harness for all environments (dev, stage, preprod, prod)
•     bip-tenant-config updated with static secret references for ECR connector
•     Configuration changes merged and synced via ArgoCD
•     Image promotion pipeline executes 5 consecutive times without Vault timeout errors
•     Documentation updated with configuration details

As a BIP AI Engineer, I need the ability to create a base image for lambdas so that tenants can build their own lambdas with ease and deployments are flexible to handle any use case.

Acceptance Criteria:
•   Base image created for lambda functions that incldues common packages (mlkit, etc.) Detailed documentation for a templatized dockerfile is create so the base image is easy to use for both BIP AI and tenant teams.

 - Dependency conflict involving tenacity, strands-agents-tools, and langchain-community resolved and PR merged.

 - Update tenant-resources strands tutorial notebook to reflect changes to mlkit

Value Statement: As an engineer I want to parse the logs coming from ARIA so we can begin managing usage and other metrics for a dashboard.

AC: Grafana dashboard with different logs parsed so metrics can be created later.
items.to_string:
Value Statement: As a user I want a disclaimer when using ARIA so that users do not use it in untindeded ways.

AC: 

- Disclaimer added to welcome message telling users not to put PII/PHI and that all answers might not be correct and for them to double-check with sources.

items.from_string:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI Tenant on the SPA team, I need the ability to receive timely support so that I can resolve issues and continue my work without unnecessary delays.

Acceptance Criteria: When a user from SPA requests support, the support team responds and assists as needed. Manual validation: Confirm support requests are tracked and resolved. Update deployment dates in Confluence for each support ticket.
items.to_string:
Value Statement:
As a Solution Engineer supporting the SPA Agentic framework, I need the ability to identify components of the current implementation that require restructuring so that the codebase, configuration, and infrastructure can be streamlined for maintainability, scalability, and alignment with BIP AI's broader deployment standards.


Acceptance Criteria:
Review of the SPA Agentic solution performed, and a comprehensive list of restructuring targets (e.g., modules, dependencies, folder structure, scripts, configs) is produced.
Redundant or legacy elements that can be removed, areas requiring consolidation or refactoring, identified.

items.from_id:
Second architecture design by Agentic Team after advised against Langgraph. 
!image.png!

items.from_string:
Value Statement: As a bip ai engineer, I want to enable the SBX delegates within the Harness management instance so that sandbox environments are able to execute workflows and pipelines securely and reliably using delegated resources.

AC: - SBX delegates are registered and enabled within the Harness management instance. - Delegates are configured with proper permissions and connectivity to required environments. - Documentation is updated to include steps for enabling, registering, and troubleshooting SBX delegates. - Validation is performed by running sample workflows/pipelines using the SBX delegates in the sandbox environment. - Any issues, errors, or limitations encountered during enablement are documented and communicated to stakeholders.
items.to_string:
Value Statement:

As a BIP AI engineer, I need the ECR connector configured to use static Harness secrets instead of Vault so that the image promotion pipeline executes reliably without intermittent authentication failures caused by Vault connectivity issues.

Acceptance Criteria:
•     ECR credential secrets created in Harness for all environments (dev, stage, preprod, prod)
•     bip-tenant-config updated with static secret references for ECR connector
•     Configuration changes merged and synced via ArgoCD
•     Image promotion pipeline executes 5 consecutive times without Vault timeout errors
•     Documentation updated with configuration details
This issue is cloned by BIP-28506

items.from_string:
Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer who executes Jupyter notebooks, I need a comprehensive tutorial notebook for Bedrock Data Automation project creation, so that I can confidently guide tenants in using this functionality.

Acceptance Criteria: - When a user opens the tutorial notebook, the user has the ability to set up a Bedrock Data Automation project using sample or tenant-specific data. - The notebook provides clear step-by-step instructions and working code examples. - Functionality of the notebook is validated through manual testing.
items.to_string:
Value Statement:
As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer who is using Bedrock Data Automation to create a project with a custom blueprint, I need work with INFRA team to resolve a permission issue when trying to validate a test to ensure that all required fields are processed from a sample PDF file.
Acceptance Criteria:
Successfully validated a test to ensure that all required fields are processed from a sample PDF file.

items.from_string: Resolve Permission Issue When Validating Test in BDA project

items.from_string:
Values Statement: As a MLOps engineer I want to be able to build the TERA endpoints in a secure CI/CD process. This process should create endpoints that can be promoted to upper environments.

AC - CI/CD process built that creates TERA endpoints in dev - (Ideally this CI/CD process can be created in stage and preprod time permitting)
items.to_string:
Value statement: "As a MLOps engineer I want to better understand the cool down time observed when trying to query a single veteran in preprod using the prototype endpoint"
AC:
A list of the testing times and latency periods observed while querying a single veteran attached as a comment to the ticket.
This issue is cloned by BIP-28468

Value Statement: As a solution engineer maintaining the SPA Agentic codebase, I need the ability to identify, remove, or archive unused or deprecated work so that the repository remains clean, relevant, and maintainable for future development cycles. Acceptance Criteria: - When a user reviews the SPA Agentic repository, they can clearly identify which components are active and which have been archived. -Unused or deprecated files, directories, and notebooks are either: -----Removed if confirmed obsolete, ------or ------Archived to a designated /archive folder - Documentation and README files reflect the current active components and reference the archived location of old work. -CI/CD or build pipelines confirm no broken imports or references after cleanup.

Value Statement: As an SPA developer who commits and reviews code, I need the ability to automatically run unit tests, pylint, and black in CI so that defects and style issues are caught early, code stays consistent, and merges remain reliable.

Acceptance Criteria: - When a user opens a PR to main or pushes to any branch, the CI pipeline runs three distinct stages: Tests, Lint, and Format-check. ----Tests: ------Executes pytest with a coverage report. ------Lint (pylint) ------Pipeline fails if any files are not properly formatted.
